articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Microsoft makes case for Activision merger amid EU scrutiny - The Star Online
articles.description: Microsoft's Xbox video game division on Tuesday announced new partnerships with Nintendo and chipmaker Nvidia as it tries to persuade European regulators to approve its planned US$68.7bil (RM304.7bil) takeover of game publishing giant Activision Blizzard.

articles.title: Sanctions against Russia have not stopped Ukraine war, but are impacting long-term, says expert - Euronews
articles.description: The EU and its allies have implemented nine package of sanctions against Moscow since the start of the conflict last year. #EuropeNews
articles.content:
One year on from Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the war has not stopped, despite the EU and its allies sanctions against Moscow.
Some argue that they are not having the desired impact, but accordi… [+2620 chars]

articles.author: Justin Carter
articles.title: CWA asks European Commission to approve Microsoft-Activision merger - Game Developer
articles.description: The CWA continues its support of Microsoft's bid for Activision Blizzard.
articles.content: The Communications Workers of America (CWA) has gone to bat for Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard again. CWA president Chris Shelton recently sent a letter to the European Commission (EC… [+2122 chars]

articles.title: China and Europe team up on tests before joint space mission in 2025 - South China Morning Post
articles.description: It marks first time a satellite made in China is shipped to European Space Agency, and for a Chinese team to help assemble and test at an ESA facility.
